Package com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.steps

Class AbstractStep<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.steps.AbstractStep<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the behavior. This is typically a functional interface like Runnable.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Step, TypeStep
    public abstract class AbstractStep<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Statusable
    Describes a step in the BDD Hierarchy.
    Hence, it contains the actual behavior.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractStep

        public AbstractStep​(com.aventstack.extentreports.GherkinKeyword keyword,
                    java.lang.String description,
                    T behavior)
        Creates an AbstractStep with the specified keyword, description and behavior.
        Parameters:
        keyword - The GherkinKeyword describing whether its a given, when, then or and step.
        description - A String describing what this step does.
        behavior - The behavior of the step.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public void test()
        Executes the step.
        It first verifies if the step can and should be run. Then sets up the reporter If reporter was specified, it first prepares the report. If skip() is set, the skipStep() method is called, otherwise executeStep() is called.
        If an Exception or Error occurs, it is re-thrown as StepException and StepError respectively.
        Throws:
        StepException - If an Exception occurs. The report shows the step as fatal.
        StepError - If an Error occurs. The report shows the step as failed.

      • skipStep

        public void skipStep()
        Skips the step.

      • skip

        public AbstractStep<T> skip()
        Skip the step.
        This means, it appears in the report, but is not executed. The following steps are executed regardless.
        Specified by:
        skip in interface Statusable
        Returns:
        The current class
